turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Manhattan Life Insurance Company.
turn.1: What is the down side of Manhattan Life Insurance Company?
turn.2: A 2009 New York State department of Financial Services report found a number of policyholder disclosure violations.
turn.3: Was there any improvement after the report?
turn.4: A follow-up examination by the same department in 2014 revealed that subsequent actions were taken by the company to satisfy each of the citations in a manner acceptable to the Department.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: For over forty years, Manhattan Life was content to rent office space, which was considered cheaper than buying real estate.
turn.7: When did they decide to buy real estate?
turn.8: In 1892, a majority of its board of directors decided that the firm should have its own home office.
turn.10: The company purchased two old buildings.
turn.11: What did they do with the buildings?
turn.12: With two years left on its lease as 156 Broadway, it prepared to build.
